title: Ping spikes with only one computer?
body:
I recently bought a computer that runs on Windows 8.1. Whenever I play a game of league however, my ping spikes and jumps at random every few seconds, making the game unplayable. It has been in this same state over the last few days, and the problem does not seem to appear on any other computer in the network. I have tried flushing dns, restarting the computer, and several other "quick" fixes, but nothing seems to work.

I also run on wireless network and have no access to wired network due to modem placement. Help?

replies.body:
Hey Fried Pizza!

If this computer is the only computer on your network experiencing issues with ping, then it appears that there is a specific setting or program on your computer that is causing these issues.  As to what specific setting or program, it is almost impossible for me to tell.  Because of this, make sure to try all of the steps in the following Knowledge Base Article:

https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/26932010-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues

It is a collect of some of the most common resolutions to issues with ping.  However, there is no guarantee that one of these steps will fix your issue.  If your still slamming your head on the keyboard to the point that the spacebar is imprinted on your forehead, make sure to [submit a new request](https://support.leagueoflegends.com/anonymous_requests/new) to us here in Player Support.  We can work with you one-on-one to investigate further and provide some further solutions.  Just make sure to include the following in the ticket:

1) Network Analysis: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1

2) NetworkInfo Log: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4

3) Process List: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3
